t3bW1fYFnXniUCoNU.name: Flight (Winged)
t3bW1fYFnXniUCoNU.notes: Air Move is Basic Speed x 2 (drop all fractions)

tdjlL5Vo-1qTEcHvG.name: Cowardice
tdjlL5Vo-1qTEcHvG.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you are called on to risk physical danger. Roll at -5 if you must risk death.

tk3_iBELBeN5O_NpB.name: Gluttony
tk3_iBELBeN5O_NpB.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with a tempting morsel or good wine that, for some reason, you should resist. If you fail, you partake – regardless of the consequences.

thUBkyiklKfQTZ3sg.name: Laziness
thUBkyiklKfQTZ3sg.notes: Your chances of getting a raise or promotion in any job are halved. If you are self-employed, halve your monthly pay.

features.situation: from others who see your looks

nDkD4y9oFgto7IaXR.text: Gargoyles are hairless, winged humanoids. Their skin ranges from off-white to ebon black and has a stony grain. The wings are bat-like, with a 10- to 12-foot wingspan. Bodies and limbs are solid and ungraceful. Gargoyles have bowed legs that give them a peculiar rolling gait when on the ground. Their hands end in fierce claws. Gargoyles stand around 5 feet tall (weight is normal for their ST, but height is 12" less than normal).

nSrWUzNwIcNxmfbUT.text: The most peculiar feature of the Gargoyle race is their faces, which are extremely mutable from individual to individual. Many are human grotesqueries. Others resemble fish, lizards or other beasts. A few faces are remarkably beautiful, but on misshapen gargoyle bodies such features are perhaps the most horrible of all.

n3U_WUvYcj6SpqVSg.text: Gargoyles seldom wear clothing, except perhaps for a few cheap trinkets of iron or tin.
